update.description:
** Post Blueprint release**

This adds an RGBD camera sensor that effectively combines a CameraSensor, DepthCameraSensor, and also outputs a pointcloud. The intent is to move the capabilities of `https://github.com/ros-simulation/gazebo_ros_pkgs/blob/kinetic-devel/gazebo_plugins/src/gazebo_ros_openni_kinect.cpp` from a ROS plugin directly into simulation.

There are a number of things I'd like to improve, such as creating new sdf elements to better support this type of camera. However, these improvements won't get into Blueprint.

So, for now a few things are hard-coded including the far clip of the depth camera and pixel formats. The depth image is also forced to be the same size as the 2D RGB image.

I chose not to modify the existing `DepthCameraSensor` because I did not want to change the behavior of an existing sensor, and I can see the need for a sensor that only produces a depth image.
update.title: Rgbd sensor

content.raw:
windows build with the correct branches:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ign_sensors-pr-win&build=169)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_sensors-pr-win/169/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_sensors-pr-win/169/
* https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebodistro/branch/sensors_rgbd_sensor#diff
content.html:
windows build with the correct branches:

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_sensors-pr-win/169/
  • https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebodistro/branch/sensors_rgbd_sensor#diff

content.raw:
> The intent is to move the capabilities of https://github.com/ros-simulation/gazebo_ros_pkgs/blob/kinetic-devel/gazebo_plugins/src/gazebo_ros_openni_kinect.cpp from a ROS plugin directly into simulation.

If you're looking at the Kinetic version of the plugin, you may be interested in [this pull request](https://github.com/ros-simulation/gazebo_ros_pkgs/pull/757) which suggests a more updated approach.
content.html:
The intent is to move the capabilities of https://github.com/ros-simulation/gazebo_ros_pkgs/blob/kinetic-devel/gazebo_plugins/src/gazebo_ros_openni_kinect.cpp from a ROS plugin directly into simulation.

If you're looking at the Kinetic version of the plugin, you may be interested in this pull request which suggests a more updated approach.
